title: BHP Billiton promotes Baroness Vadera and appoints Anita Frew to board

Fri, Aug 14, 2015, 15:40 BST - UK Markets close in 50 mins. BHP Billiton promotes Baroness Vadera and appoints Anita Frew to board By Oliver Haill | Sharecast â€“ 4 hours ago 1,879.9999 -11.0001 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - BHP Billiton (NYSE: BBL - news ) has shuffled its board, with a new non-executive appointment and the promotion of Baroness Shriti Vadera to senior director following the death of Sir John Buchanan last month. Anita Frew, current Lloyds Bank deputy chairman and a senior director of the engineer IMI (LSE: IMI.L - news ) and chairman of Victrex (LSE: VCT.L - news ) , has been appointed to the Anglo-Australian mining giant as an independent non-executive director (NED) from 15 September. 
"Anita's depth of experience in strategic and risk management, marketing and governance across a broad range of sectors will enable her to make a significant contribution to the board," said BHP chairman Jac Nasser. 
At the same time, Vadera, former Gordon Brown 'fixer', has been appointed as senior independent director and member of the nomination and governance committee, effective immediately. 
The Ugandan-born former investment banker, a veteran of UBS Warburg, has been a NED at BHP Billiton since 2011. 
Meanwhile, Carlos Cordeiro, who has been a NED since 2005, will retire from the board after the annual shareholder meeting in November.
